channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Space and Censorship: The EU’s Struggle with Musk
item.description: The week of October 14, 2024: Brussels vs. Musk, housing, labor, healthcare, and electric vehicles.

item.title: Book Review: Resistance Money: A Philosophical Case for Bitcoin
item.description: Should I add bitcoin to my portfolio? If not, why not? This book will help advisors field these tough client questions.

item.title: When Did Google Search Become Totally Useless?
item.description: Why bother with making information accessible and usable if you can tell people what you want them to hear instead?

item.title: Americans Cannot Afford Harris’s Home Health Entitlement
item.description: Instead of expanding Medicare’s footprint, we should pursue more-sustainable solutions to address the long-term-care crisis.

item.title: An Industry in Transition: AI Top of Mind in 2024 Asset Manager Survey
item.description: The Index Industry Association's 2024 asset manager survey reveals a much deeper set of challenges, opportunities, hopes, and concerns.

item.title: WI State Bar Brings In Architect Of Abusive John Doe Probe To Talk Election Integrity
item.description: Kevin Kennedy, Wisconsin's former elections chief, played a central role in the unconstitutional John Doe investigations into conservatives.

item.title: Exclusive: DeFi platform Azura launches after raising $6.9 million from Initialized
item.description: 21-year-old founder Jackson Denka says Azura will “let anyone trade anything from anywhere.”

item.title: These races will make or break the House majority on Nov. 5
item.description: The Washington Times honed in on 14 pivotal House races that will decide which party holds the majority in the next Congress.

item.title: Tesla is having a rough year—this week’s earnings may provide more of the same
item.description: The lack of clarity about the company’s short-term strategy may be weighing on the stock, which is down 13% this year.

item.title: Happy 60th Anniversary CAPM! Why the Capital Asset Pricing Model Still Matters
item.description: The CAPM has its critics. Yet, the model, introduced by Bill Sharpe in 1964, remains front and center in academia and in practice.

item.title: Georgia Supreme Court to consider new GOP-backed ballot rules after judge strikes down
item.description: The Georgia Supreme Court will hear the RNC's appeal of a judge's decision to block several new election rules from taking effect.

item.title: The School Choice Programs Democrats Hate Have Saved Taxpayers Up To $45 Billion
item.description: When families receive an ESA, which is typically around half of what the state spends per public education student, the state saves money.

item.title: Yellen says world was ‘worse off’ under Trump-era isolationism
item.description: Yellen opened the IMF and World Bank annual meetings by highlighting U.S. economic growth since the nation was in the grips of the COVID-19 pandemic.

item.title: Don’t Forget the Catholic Bishops Persecuted by China
item.description: They stand as a testament to the reality that China represses the Catholic Church along with all its other religions.

item.title: HSBC names Pam Kaur as first female CFO in bank’s history
item.description: The 60-year-old brings a long focus on auditing, risks and compliance across almost four decades of banking career spanning various global lenders.

item.title: Donald Trump gains slight edge over Kamala Harris in Georgia
